course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Capstone Research I
course.description: Students will carry out a research project in one of the Chemistry research laboratories under the supervision of a faculty member. This research-based course provides students an opportunity to integrate and apply their chemical knowledge learnt in regular lecture and laboratory courses. At the end of the course, students are required to submit a written report and deliver an oral presentation to document their learning experiences. For CHEM students only. Students should seek instructor's approval prior to enrollment in the course.
course.prerequisites: CHEM 3550 AND CHEM 3555

reviews.author: mpyser
reviews.title: Very good grade
reviews.comment_content:
要視乎你個prof 比啲咩topic你做，然後佢會安排相關post doc比你跟。

**Prof. Huang 雖然係關於physical chem, 但係佢比我嘅topic 都係有關bio (cell, tissue)個啲，所以你如果想真係學純chem野， 唔係好推薦你跟。（詳細可以上網search下佢啲paper看下佢做緊咩）

一開始我同Prof. Huang 開左個 f2f meeting 傾 topic, 佢比左3個topic 我揀（怕我唔識仲每一個都explain比我)， 後面都有帶我去lab參觀下。 但係之後除左最後presentation都冇見過佢， 但係佢安排左個好靠譜嘅post doc比我跟。

後面就follow post doc嘅instruction做嘢，然後exam period 最後一日 presentation， 再7日後交篇3000-5000字thesis
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Huang 好好人，雖然覆email有啲慢， 但係佢真係好仔細同我解釋每一個topic大概做咩，後面Q&A 都冇話刁難。

個post doc 都係勁有耐性教，有咩問題唔識都可以問佢，佢成日秒覆機。presentation/交thesis之前可以send比佢過目下，佢會比啲suggestion.
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall Course Grading:
1. Lab participation and performance (50%)
2. Research Thesis (30%)
3. Oral Presentation (20%)

For Research Thesis:
1. Overall Science Content (40%)
2. Presentation of Data and Results (20%)
3. Discussion and Conclusion (30%)
4. Proper Thesis Design and Referencing (10%)

For Oral Presentation:
1. Overall Science Content (40%)
2. Presentation of Data and Results (30%)
3. Effective Oral Communication (15%)
4. Q&A (15%)



But I got an A+  (; ; )
reviews.comment_workload:
我覺得相對都算少（比起其他同學）

但係有時候post doc要做完手上面啲lab先有時間教同比我地做，所以成日星期六日夜晚要突然返去做，而且做實驗時間有啲唔穩定 (因為我個topic 同cell 有關， 所以要視乎cell狀態同post doc會突然通知）當然你唔得閒可以唔番，佢有講如果有事可以唔去lab, 但我覺得我有50%係佢手上，所以我點都返去。所以哩個lab個自由度冇其他lab高（li個topic黎講，都要post doc得閒在場幫我地set好曬野）

data都係用佢地電腦啲software去測，處理data就用excel同origin, 所以都幾簡單，workload唔大(origin可能要上網自己學下）

Workload 比較大係exam period 後面個presentation。 因為我係前一日都有考試，所以整powerpoint時間好趕。

後面篇thesis都好簡單，寫完result & discussion,字數都過半

reviews.author: Brownpanda
reviews.comment_content:
Do a research project under the supervision of a prof. Visit his lab frequently and learn from the pg students.
Topic of project wasn't choose by ourselves, so it is not what I expected.
reviews.comment_teaching: Can learn a lot of lab techniques from the pg students. They were sometimes quite busy, but they were still reachable and willing to answer questions. . Prof will visit the lab a few times a day. You can say that the prof is caring... or annoying. I didn't really learn a thing from the prof. I can tell that pg students were not close to their prof as well. I chose this prof because he speaks Cantonese and he seems nice in lectures. But after three months of capstone research in this lab, I don't want to stay under his supervision anymore.
reviews.comment_workload:
I will say the workload is not light. Need to visit the lab every week, 9-10 hours working hours per week. Seems this is different in different labs.
Since I was learning completely different skills from what we learnt in syn lab and mc lab, it was not easy.
Need to write a long written report and give a presentation in front of a few classmates and three profs. Both of them took me a lot of time to prepare. As the topics of the research project was very new to me, I need to read a lot of research paper that I was not very familiarize with.

reviews.author: EdogawaC
reviews.title: Ok to do capstone but don’t get baited into pursuing graduate degree
reviews.comment_content:
As course name suggest, basically need to do original research under the guidance of prof. and PG/RA mentor. Most of the time is spent doing lab work. Project was pretty meh, not too difficult but not very interesting either.
there are also 4 library workshops concerning the usage of search engines, Refworks for citations, and softwares for drawing professional chemical structures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
RA mentor was super nice and friendly, learned a lot of lab techniques. Prof sometimes came over and checked on progress, he was available if you have questions and seemed friendly. Don’t be fooled though, if he offered you to join his lab as research graduate student, think twice! His mentoring is questionable at best, and I know that because of personal experience and also from past members. Fantastic teacher perhaps, effective PI and good leader? Not so much.
Hint: 2210,3210,4240
To all the UG comrades, profs speaking canton =/= being good PIs, choose labs that actually do innovative and interesting research, or you'll suffer.
reviews.comment_grading:
Sh*t grade.
50% research participation (expect ~ 9 hours per week of lab); 30% written report, 20% presentation. Attendance to library workshop also compulsory.
reviews.comment_workload: Depends on how much time you are willing to spend in lab. Worked about 40 hrs/week, but didn't get many meaningful results, though still enough to write report. Without that awesome RA mentor, life would’ve been hell.
